intro: Antirrhinum pelisserianum, commonly known as the Pelisserian toadflax, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Europe. It typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces showy, two-lipped flowers in shades of yellow to orange, which bloom from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and slightly hairy, often arranged oppositely along the stems. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders.
